item.title: Poland to probe links between Epstein and Russian intelligence
item.description: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk says the step has been taken amid growing speculation that "this unprecedented paedophilia scandal was co-organised by Russian intelligence services".

item.title: Officers find signs of forced entry at home of TV host Savannah Guthrie's mother
item.description: Investigators reportedly found evidence of a deliberate night-time kidnapping at the property.

item.title: Thousands of parents seek support as children cannot go to school
item.description: Thousands of Australian parents are struggling with children who cannot go to school. A new podcast and e-book have been released to help support them.

item.title: What could the government do to help battle inflation?
item.description: The federal government has a variety of options available if it wants to do more to stave off inflation, but none are popular.

item.title: Elite women athletes finding ways to work smarter, to help sporting and professional careers
item.description: The sport-work-life balance is a struggle faced by many female athletes, but many are finding meaningful ways to diversify their income to secure their future.

item.title: SA Liberals face three major threats in One Nation, a popular premier and independents
item.description: While South Australia is considered a more moderate state than Queensland or New South Wales, March's state election will still be a chance to gauge the seriousness of One Nation's polling surge and the impact of the Coalition split on the Liberal Party's brand.

item.title: More than 1.5m AI bots are now socialising on Moltbook — but experts say that's not the scary part
item.description: A social network run entirely by AI bots has attracted more than a million users — but experts warn it is not what the bots are saying that poses the true risk.

item.title: How to know if you're experiencing PTSD
item.description: Louise was experiencing nightmares for five years before being diagnosed with post-traumatic stress disorder.

item.title: Sydney students tackle climate change livability as world records hottest three years
item.description: The designs include cooling devices for street lights, air-purifying pods for train stations and re-imagined bus shelters to improve livability, after the world records its hottest three years ever.

item.title: Boost for development of low-emissions alternatives to glass wine bottles
item.description: The federal government provides $2 million towards developing low-emissions alternatives to glass wine bottles using materials like seaweed and plant sugar.

item.title: What the Epstein files tell us about Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's 'car crash' 2019 interview
item.description: Documents released last week have shed more light on what the former prince might have been lying about in that fateful sit-down with the BBC's flagship current affairs program, Newsnight.

item.title: Formula 1 driver Jack Doohan signs with Haas as reserve driver after leaving Alpine
item.description: Former Alpine racer Jack Doohan signed with Haas as a reserve driver for the 2026 Formula 1 season.

item.title: Otways residents burnt out of their 'paradise' determined to rebuild home
item.description: The Cochrane family has called the Otways home for more than four decades. Even after fires destroyed their property, they do not plan to move.

item.title: Fire breaks out after alleged ram raid north of Melbourne
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Brazen ram raid and fire at Mooroopna gift shop caught on camera
item.description: Police have released footage of a ram raid and fire at a gift shop in the regional town of Mooroopna near Shepparton, north of Melbourne.

item.title: Donald Trump says Republicans should 'nationalise' US elections
item.description: Donald Trump says he wants Republicans to "nationalise" US elections and has encouraged his party to "take over the voting" in at least some parts of the country.

item.title: Extreme heat will make Northern Territory unlivable within 40 years, activists warn
item.description: The Climate Justice Alliance says rising temperatures and increasingly severe heatwaves present a direct and immediate threat to people across the Territory, particularly in the Top End.

item.title: Jill Biden's first husband charged with killing wife in domestic dispute at Delaware home
item.description: William Stevenson is charged with the murder of his wife, Linda Stevenson, at their Delaware home on December 28.

item.title: Dr Karl's How Things Work quiz: How much do you really know about guitars?
item.description: From shaping to tuning — how much do you know about how an acoustic guitar is made?

item.title: 'Rogue' tour guides threaten Gold Coast glow-worm population
item.description: Last year two operators were fined for running glow-worm cave tours in the Springbrook and Tamborine national parks without the required permits.

item.title: ASX climbs after Wall Street's tech sell-off as bitcoin trades around $US76,000 — as it happened
item.description: The Australian share market edges up after a brutal session on Wall Street, weighed down by massive losses in tech and AI stocks like Nvidia and Microsoft, while bitcoin trades around $76,000 after dropping to a 16-month low.

item.title: Australia knocked out of under-19 Cricket World Cup by England
item.description: Ollie Peake's hobbling and defiant captain's knock of 100 has proved too little too late to rescue Australia as their reign as under-19 World Cup champions was ended by England in a compelling semifinal in Zimbabwe.

item.title: Forestry industry sounds alarm over 'cheap' timber imports landing in Australia and threatening jobs
item.description: Imported timber is coming into Australia at nearly half the price of domestically manufactured products and is increasingly being used in local homes.

item.title: Survival expert praises WA family's calm decision-making during miracle Geographe Bay rescue
item.description: "Outback Mike" Atkinson says the Appelbee family's ability to stay calm and make smart decisions was critical to their survival after they were swept out to sea off Geographe Bay.

item.title: Greens link Hospitality Tasmania's donations to Liberals to pokies card demise
item.description: The Tasmanian Greens have accused the state's peak hospitality group and the Liberal Party of a "political stitch-up" to kill off the proposed mandatory pokies card, after hundreds of thousands of dollars in donations were revealed.

item.title: Rockhampton residents supporting the homeless as council considers rough sleepers' hub
item.description: Cheryl Dolan felt a sense of desperation as she walked through the parks of her central Queensland city. Now, she is taking action and calling for change.

item.title: SA Police investigates damage to eight historical graves at Kapunda Cemetery
item.description: Police are appealing for information about the destruction of historically significant graves north of Adelaide.

item.title: Randa Abdel-Fattah to appear at one-off Adelaide literary festival Constellations
item.description: Palestinian Australian author, lawyer and activist Randa Abdel-Fattah will be appearing at the one-off literary event created to fill the void left by the cancellation of this year's Adelaide Writers' Week, organisers have announced.

item.title: Travel blogger called out for visit to asbestos-ridden former Wittenoom town site with young daughter
item.description: Asbestos disease advocates criticise a Queensland blogger for taking her daughter to one of Australia's most contaminated sites.

item.title: Western Australia's oldest lighthouse at risk from rising sea levels in Geraldton
item.description: The Point Moore lighthouse has kept seafarers safe along the unforgiving Batavia Coast since 1878, but a maritime historian says there needs to be a firm plan to protect it from future erosion and rising sea levels.

item.title: Four new rule changes announced for the 2026 NRL season, kick-off tweak to be trialled
item.description: A proposed rule change to the rugby league kick-off will not be enforced at the start of the 2026 NRL season and will instead be trialled during matches later in the year.

item.title: Drought-affected SA farmers able to access low-interest loans of up to $250,000
item.description: The SA government has stepped in with an "unprecedented" offer of direct low-interest loans to farmers hit hard by years of drought.

item.title: Up to 100,000 dead fish found on bank of Lake Menindee
item.description: Residents of a far west New South Wales community found tens of thousands of dead fish on the banks of Lake Menindee.

item.title: Defence Department announces plans to sell off Leeuwin and Irwin Barracks in Perth
item.description: The Department of Defence announces plans to sell off both Leeuwin and Irwin barracks, freeing up dozens of hectares of residential land in prime Perth suburbs.

item.title: Demons defender Steven May misses AFL pre-season training
item.description: Melbourne Demons veteran Steven May was not at training for his club on Wednesday, just six weeks out from the start of the 2026 AFL season.

item.title: Art exhibitions to see this summer, from Ron Mueck to Hobart Current and Olafur Eliasson
item.description: From Aussie expat Ron Mueck's hyper-realistic sculptures and Icelandic Danish artist Olafur Eliasson's thought-provoking installations to the best contemporary artists in Tasmania, here are three exhibitions to see.

item.title: Ban on sand flathead fishing in south-eastern Tasmania amid severe decline in numbers
item.description: Populations of sand flathead have "severely declined" in Tasmanian waters, prompting the government to close a fishery in the state's south-east to recreational anglers.

item.title: Diamonds eye timely glimpse of Jamaica in Test series ahead of Commonwealth Games
item.description: Australia's netballers expect to gain precious intelligence ahead of a showpiece tournament when they host Jamaica in a three-Test series.

item.title: Teen charged with rape and taking a person by force after Flagstaff Hill park incident
item.description: A 16-year-old boy is facing charges of rape and taking a person by force after the alleged sexual assault of another teenager in Adelaide's south on Saturday night, police say.

item.title: Ski racing event planned for SA's Lake Bonney cancelled amid permit requirement issues
item.description: A ski racing event which was advertised to go ahead this weekend in South Australia's Riverland has been cancelled by organisers at the 11th hour.

item.title: Australian man Michael 'Micky' Hurst dies in Japan while skiing
item.description: Michael Hurst had a medical episode and died on the slopes in Hokkaido, making it three Australians in total that have died in Japan this year.

item.title: Report finds NT residents feel less safe and less satisfied with police despite crime crackdown
item.description: A new report reveals NT residents felt less safe over the past year, despite a government crackdown on crime.

item.title: $15b National Reconstruction Fund allowed to back 'losers' in push to cut emissions
item.description: The $15 billion fund will be allowed to back riskier green projects under new rules announced today.

item.title: Police lecture teen caught driving 189km/h on Sunshine Motorway at midnight
item.description: The teenager on his P-plates was pulled over by police along a Sunshine Coast motorway driving at almost 200km/h.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Former deputy Liberal leader Sam Groth quits Victorian parliament, triggering Nepean by-election
item.description: Retired tennis star and former deputy Liberal leader Sam Groth will quit Victorian parliament next week, about a month after announcing he would not contest November's state election.

item.title: Malaysian PM Anwar Ibrahim and India's Narendra Modi named in Epstein files
item.description: The prime ministers of Malaysia and India deny having links with disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein after their names appeared in a tranche of files released by the US Department of Justice.

item.title: Inquest to be held into baby girl's mysterious death in Queensland
item.description: The baby's family says it's "distressing" that the inquest comes several years after the baby's death, but hopes it helps other families.

item.title: Trump's failure to extend nuclear treaty leaves door 'wide open' to arms race
item.description: The last remaining nuclear arms pact between the United States and Russia has come to an end at a time of global instability.

item.title: NSW parliamentary inquiry to investigate mould and maggot issues at Newcastle's Mater Hospital
item.description: Shadow Minister for Health Sarah Mitchell has successfully moved a motion in parliament for an inquiry at the Calvary Mater Hospital, after the discovery of mould and maggots.

item.title: Police condemn dozens of e-bike riders for Sydney Harbour Bridge stunt
item.description: Police are combing over CCTV of Tuesday's stunt where officers believe several offences were committed.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Northern Territory mum wrangles Humpty Doo crocodile near Arnhem Highway
item.description: Melody Wehipeihana was dropping her kids off at school when she pulled over to see what a crowd had gathered to look at in a puddle outside a Northern Territory pub.

item.title: Banned tennis player Thomas Fancutt makes comeback after IV vitamin breach
item.description: Thomas Fancutt has made his return to professional tennis after receiving a 10-month ban for a vitamin and magnesium infusion.

item.title: Scammers staged a fake AFP set in a Cambodian compound. Here's what we know
item.description: A fake AFP office staged by scammers who operated from a Cambodian scam centre reveals much about their tactics, experts say.

item.title: Why these women took marriage sabbaticals — and how it went
item.description: Do you ever feel like taking a break from your marriage? Three women share how a marriage sabbatical changed their relationship.

item.title: Doberman pinscher named Penny wins top prize at Westminster Dog Show
item.description: Penny bested six other finalists at New York's Madison Square Garden to win the show dog world's most coveted prize, after more than 2,500 dogs strutted their stuff.

item.title: World's fastest falcon spotted in Central Australian outback for the first time
item.description: The world's fastest falcon has been spotted in Central Australia for the first time, surprising even the seasoned birdwatcher who caught the rare sight on camera.

item.title: Queensland man who posted photo of a child sex offender online labelled vigilante by magistrate
item.description: The first person charged over misusing the state's new child sex offender registry has been handed a six-month good behaviour bond and accused of vigilantism.

item.title: Living costs rise for all but some hit harder, new ABS data finds
item.description: Cost-of-living pressures are being felt by all households, but some have been hit harder than others as annual costs increased between 2.3 and 4.2 per cent in 2025, according to the Australian Bureau of Statistics.

item.title: Illawarra man faces fresh sexual assault, choking and coercive control charges
item.description: An Illawarra man already facing serious domestic violence charges has been given six more, including rape and coercive control.

item.title: FOI documents reveal how Anika Wells's New York trip costs escalated
item.description: The final New York travel bill for Communications Minister Anika Wells and her staffer rose $7,000 from an initial booking due to last-minute changes.

item.title: K'gari traditional owners hold smoking ceremony for Piper James on beach where she died
item.description: K'gari traditional owners have held a smoking ceremony for Piper James, who died on the island last month, to give her spirit a safe passage home.

item.title: Raymond Reddington's trial told wife Sharon Fulton was murdered for insurance money
item.description: Raymond Reddington failed to report his wife missing for several days, changed his story multiple times and wrote a fake confession letter to the state coroner, a Perth court hears.

item.title: Second inquest wraps up into the disappearance of escort Revelle Balmain at Kingsford in 1994
item.description: An inquest has wrapped up into the disappearance of Sydney escort Revelle Balmain, 31 years after she was reported missing.

item.title: Austin Appelbee's incredible tale of survival has made international headlines. How did the 13yo do it?
item.description: Austin Appelbee, 13, has made international headlines after swimming for four hours in rough seas to save his mum, sister and brother stranded in the ocean. How did he do it?

item.title: Second person charged after death of three-week-old baby south of Brisbane in 2024
item.description: A 24-year-old woman has been charged with cruelty to children following a police investigation into the death of a newborn baby south of Brisbane in 2024.

item.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Two men face trial over string of alleged public shootings on the Mid North Coast
item.description: A trial has commenced for two men and their alleged involvement in a string of public shootings on the New South Wales Mid North Coast.

item.title: What is India’s Nipah virus and should Australians be worried?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: NT government to clear way for remote rent hikes, DV murder sentencing 'loopholes' remain
item.description: The Northern Territory government has moved to rush through changes to remote housing laws that would clear the way for rent hikes without the need to consult residents.

item.title: Australia announces Jakara Anthony, Matt Graham as 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics flag bearers
item.description: Jakara Anthony and Matt Graham have been named as flag bearers for the 2026 Winter Olympic Games in Milano Cortina.

item.title: Marius Borg Høiby, son of Norwegian crown princess, denies rape charges in testimony
item.description: Marius Borg Høiby is pleading not guilty to the most serious charges of rape and domestic violence but admits some lesser charges, including driving too fast.

item.title: Trump administration pulls 700 immigration officers out of Minnesota
item.description: The administration's border tsar says the decision came after local and state authorities agreed to cooperate more closely with its immigration crackdown.

item.title: Ryan Routh sentenced to life in prison for attempted assassination of Donald Trump on Florida golf course
item.description: Ryan Routh will spend the rest of his life behind bars for his 2024 assassination attempt on the then US presidential hopeful.

item.title: Tasmania trials school collaborations to boost students' results under education reform
item.description: As Tasmanian students return to school today, three primary schools will kick off a nation-leading trial the government hopes will stop the state's education system lagging behind the rest of the country.

item.title: 'Bloodbath' at Washington Post as massive layoffs announced
item.description: The Jeff Bezos-owned paper, which famously brought down US President Richard Nixon, will drastically cut back in size and lay off workers in all its departments.

item.title: A 'ghost airport' and sinkhole highway as Timor-Leste gambles on oil and gas with Greater Sunrise project
item.description: The Greater Sunrise gas project was meant to transform Timor-Leste and bring billions in revenue, but locals are still waiting for the jobs and opportunities that were promised.

item.title: Attorney-General asked anti-corruption chief to explain himself after Defence ties emerged
item.description: Attorney-General Michelle Rowland asked Paul Brereton to explain why his ongoing ties to Defence had not been "adequately" disclosed in a letter sent last year.

item.title: Online safety watchdog says tech giants failing to detect child abuse
item.description: Major tech companies including Apple, Google, Meta and Microsoft are still failing to do enough to detect and stop child sexual abuse, eSafety has claimed.

item.title: Report points to exploitation, Medicare and visa concerns in Pacific islander jobs scheme
item.description: Changing jobs is a basic right for most people, but it is not so simple for Pacific Australia Labour Mobility workers.

item.description: Findings from the coronial inquest into the Westfield Bondi Junction stabbing have been handed down, almost two years on from the attack.

item.title: In Zak Hilditch's horror movie We Bury the Dead, the zombie apocalypse devastates Tasmania
item.description: These Final Hours writer and director Zak Hilditch drew on personal tragedy to produce We Bury the Dead, his biggest cinematic epic yet.

item.title: Report calls for Australia to grow security, trade and diplomatic ties with Taiwan because of China's influence
item.description: Experts say Australia needs to do more to grow its relationship with Taiwan as China works to diplomatically isolate Taipei in the region.

item.title: Fears SA's endangered glossy black-cockatoo eggs will 'cook' in nesting boxes during heatwave
item.description: South Australia's population of a unique subspecies of glossy black-cockatoos is heavily dependent on artificial nesting boxes. That could pose a problem during extreme heat conditions.

item.description: A confrontation caught on body-worn security footage in the halls of the Toowoomba Hospital maternity unit highlights concerns raised by local mothers.

item.description: A man accused of mimicking firing on people near the pedestrian bridge where the Bondi terror attack occurred has been denied bail.

item.title: Parramatta Eels veteran Josh Addo-Carr urges young teammates to step up after Zac Lomax depature
item.description: Parramatta's next generation of outside backs must step up if they are to fill the void left by Zac Lomax, his ex-teammate Josh Addo-Carr has said.

item.title: 'Ironic' and 'lazy' AI-generated images shared on Queensland government department social media accounts
item.description: A Queensland government department has urged social media users not to trust AI through the use of an AI-generated image.

item.title: High Court to consider limiting CSL Australia's liability for accident that sank two tugboats in Tasmania
item.description: A convention on laws of the high seas will be front and centre in the High Court in Canberra today as the owners of the MV Goliath take on the Tasmanian Ports Corporation over an incident where the ship hit and sank two tugboats.

item.title: Thousands left in limbo as National Rental Affordability Scheme comes to an end this year
item.description: Vulnerable and elderly residents in homes subsidised by the National Rental Affordability Scheme are staring down decade-long waitlists for social housing as the scheme draws to a close.

item.title: Pauline Hanson returns to Senate seat after seven-day suspension — as it happened
item.description: One Nation Leader Pauline Hanson has returned to her seat in the Senate after she was suspended for seven sitting days.

item.description: With the announcement of two new facilities outside of Melbourne, could regional Victoria become a hotspot for data centres?

item.description: Marine Rescue workers tasked with monitoring WA's Geographe Bay say last week's astonishing rescue of a Perth family highlights the dangers facing tourists.

item.title: Silver plunges over 14 per cent as ACTU pushes above-inflation wages — as it happened
item.description: Spot silver has hit a new low, crashing to $US75 an ounce, down over 14 per cent, while the ACTU is pushing for "above-inflation" wage increases in 2026.

item.title: Police launch investigation into sudden death in Toowoomba
item.description: Police have closed part of Bell Street and the Toowoomba bus terminal car park on Chronicle Lane in Toowoomba's CBD as part of the investigation.

item.title: What is the difference between a tropical low and cyclone in northern Australia?
item.description: Tropical lows are weaker than tropical cyclones, but a meteorologist explains they can still cause significant damage.

item.title: Central Queensland conservation group wants to see more transparency on coal mine water releases
item.description: There were 55 water releases from the region's coal mines in the month of January into the largest catchment draining to the Great Barrier Reef.

item.description: Around a dozen boats recovered by Marine Safety Queensland were part-time or permanent liveaboard boats, with boaties in the Whitsundays facing a long journey to find a new permanent home on or off the water.

item.title: Donald Trump, gold, interest rates and AI data centres to dominate company reporting season
item.description: Australia's mining sector is expected to lead the earnings charge for this reporting season, boosted by signs of a stabilisation in the Chinese economy and a turbo-charged commodities market.

item.title: NRL rookie Sebastian Su'a poised for breakout year after injury-plagued 2025 season with Dolphins
item.description: The work ethic of a former Test fast bowler and the mentoring of an elite prop are inspiring Dolphins rookie Sebastian Su'a's NRL quest.

item.title: Worker's death at Tanami gold mine in Central Australia under investigation
item.description: A 47-year-old worker has died following an incident at the Tanami gold mine in remote Central Australia, with police and NT WorkSafe investigating.

item.description: A new online resource aims to make it easier for people to contribute to bushfire relief efforts across Victoria.

item.title: How Super Bowl-bound Aussie Michael Dickson became NFL's best punter
item.description: Michael Dickson has become one of the finest punters in the NFL, and could become just the second Australian to play in a victorious Super Bowl team.

item.title: Police executing drug raid find deadly snakes, crocodile in alleged makeshift zoo
item.description: More than 50 reptiles, including a 1.3-metre crocodile, have been seized after police discovered an alleged makeshift zoo during a drug raid on the NSW Mid North Coast.

item.title: Australians in Japan say ski fields are safe after spate of deaths
item.description: Australians working in Japan's ski fields say while the sport has unpredictable risks, there are ways to be prepared.

item.title: Owner of Arnie the German shepherd sentenced over death of dog and misleading police
item.description: A Queensland man who claimed his dog Arnie had been stolen, despite having left the German shepherd in his car, where it was later found dead, has pleaded guilty.

item.title: Two people in custody after alleged Huon Valley home invasion
item.description: Police take two people into custody in relation to an alleged early morning home invasion and firearms theft in the Huon Valley.

item.title: State of Origin 2027 in New Zealand hailed as a boost for rugby league by Kiwi great
item.description: The NRL's reported landmark move to host a State of Origin match in New Zealand is hailed as "sensational" by Kiwi legend Gary Freeman.

item.title: Invasion Day bomb declared terror act, as accused's 'pro-white ideology' probed
item.description: The attempted bombing of an Invasion Day rally in Perth's CBD last week is declared a terrorist attack by authorities.

item.title: Union calls for urgent response after Ashley Youth Detention Centre staff hospitalised
item.description: A union claims management at Tasmania's youth prison did not follow its own short-staffing policy, despite an incident occurring only a day after workers took strike action due to safety concerns.

item.title: Strict caps on bottled water extraction urged for World Heritage-listed Springbrook
item.description: A long-awaited study warns that the extraction of bottled water from the World Heritage-listed Springbrook area poses a potential risk to the ancient Gondwana rainforests and should be strictly limited.

item.description: Melbourne veteran Steven May is being investigated by the AFL integrity unit, as the premiership defender stays away from Demons training.

item.description: Australia's biggest employers are under pressure to give their workers pay increases above 4 per cent this year, as real wages go backwards and the union movement ramps up pressure.

item.description: A mother of two autistic children living in regional Western Australia has shared her experience of navigating bureaucracy while caring for children with complex needs.

item.description: A Far North Queensland mayor has pleaded guilty to two counts of breaching his bail conditions after he was found drinking tea in a casino with a person he must avoid.

item.title: More than 200 Daly River residents evacuated amid flood threat, with most staying at Darwin's Foskey Pavilion
item.description: Hundreds of Daly River residents have been evacuated to Darwin ahead of expected major flooding, with Foskey Pavilion set up to accommodate most of the evacuees.

item.title: Melbourne public housing tower residents win injunction against eviction notices ahead of High Court bid
item.description: Homes Victoria will be temporarily halted from evicting remaining residents at three Melbourne public housing towers in Flemington and North Melbourne, after an injunction was issued in Victoria's Court of Appeal.

item.title: Bunnings wins fight to use AI facial recognition tech to combat store crime, opening door for other retailers
item.description: Bunnings was reasonably entitled to use AI facial recognition technology to combat crime and staff abuse in its stores, the Administrative Review Tribunal finds.

item.title: Murray-Darling Basin Authority hands down discussion paper ahead of first review in 14 years
item.description: The Murray-Darling Basin Authority says the basin plan has delivered real benefits, but climate change, disconnected floodplains and poor water quality mean things still need to change.

item.title: NSW government contacts Newcastle Writers Festival about author Randa Abdel-Fattah's inclusion
item.description: The NSW government makes contact with the board of next month's Newcastle Writers Festival about the inclusion of Palestinian-Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah, the ABC understands.

item.title: Albanese, Ley condemn alleged act of terror targeting Indigenous protesters
item.description: The prime minister and opposition leader have both condemned the alleged attempted bombing of an Invasion Day rally more than a week ago, after police revealed it was being prosecuted as a terror incident.

item.title: Today show host Savannah Guthrie asks for proof her mother is alive in social media video
item.description: The Today show host releases a video on Instagram asking for proof her mother is still alive.

item.title: Democrat victory in Republican stronghold could spell trouble for Trump
item.description: The US has been gripped by cold weather in recent weeks, but pundits say it is in Texas where hell has truly frozen over. A blue wave just swept a GOP stronghold, and Republicans are very worried.

item.title: What will happen to the land from the sale of Perth's Irwin and Leeuwin barracks, and where will the money go?
item.description: The planned sale of the Irwin and Leeuwin barracks in Perth will see dozens of hectares of potentially prime residential land hit the market. So is it likely to be used for housing, and what difference will it really make?

item.title: Gus Lamont disappearance from Oak Park Station near Yunta: What has happened so far
item.description: It is now more than four months since Gus Lamont went missing from his family's home in South Australia's outback, with the case being declared a major crime on Thursday. Here's what has happened so far.

item.title: How capital gains tax changes could impact you
item.description: According to a well-sourced leak, changes to capital gains tax discounts could form the centrepiece of the next federal budget in May. And while the government has downplayed the idea, it has not been ruled out.

item.title: Union urges Sanjeev Gupta to sell Tahmoor mine as $350m offer revealed
item.description: The Mining and Energy Union says a firm $350 million offer is on the table to restart Tahmoor Colliery, warning delays risk the mine's future and hundreds of jobs.

item.title: Man convicted of grooming one girl and raping another at Canberra Reptile Zoo
item.description: A 26-year-old man has been convicted in the ACT Supreme Court of sexually assaulting two girls at Canberra Reptile Zoo.

item.title: Coroner recommends Ambulance Victoria guideline review following nut allergy death of Max McKenzie
item.description: The coroner could not definitively rule that the anaphylaxis death of 15-year-old Max McKenzie was preventable, despite identifying delays in the teen's medical treatment.

item.title: Shadow arts minister calls for Mardi Gras funding review, accuses board of infiltration
item.description: The cancellation of the LGBTQIA+ parade's afterparty has escalated to the NSW parliament, with the Pride in Protest group being accused of threatening the viability of the event.

item.title: Thursday Finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Alleged attempted murder victim gives evidence in Shaun Michael Dunk trial
item.description: A woman who was stabbed multiple times in an alleged attack which killed her colleague at an Adelaide real estate office tells a court of her “fight for life”. Warning: This story contains content some readers may find distressing.

item.title: Nationals issue Ley with reunion counteroffer as deadline looms
item.description: The minor party has given the opposition leader terms that one Nationals MP said they did "not expect" would be acceptable in what has been described as a bid to push out her self-imposed deadline.

item.title: Victoria and Queensland lose 17 wickets on day one of MCG Sheffield Shield game
item.description: After the two-day Ashes Test raised eyebrows over the MCG pitch, Queensland and Victoria are on track for another swift finish after 17 wickets on day one of their Sheffield Shield clash.

item.title: Bondi Junction inquest saw recommendation for supported housing for homeless, some are already benefitting
item.description: An inquest into the Bondi Junction stabbing has recommended that the NSW government support long-term accommodation for homeless people experiencing mental health issues. It's a model that is already finding success.

item.title: Porsches, Maserati allegedly stolen from Melbourne homes during overnight crime spree
item.description: Four young men are charged after allegedly stealing three luxury vehicles from homes across Melbourne on Thursday morning.

item.title: Diamonds defeat Jamaica in first netball Test match in Adelaide
item.description: The Diamonds made a flying start with the initial six goals in a comprehensive 72-41 victory at the Adelaide Entertainment Centre.

item.title: Keir Starmer apologises to Epstein's victims for appointing Lord Mandelson as ambassador to US
item.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer says former ambassador to the US Peter Mandelson lied when asked about the nature of his relationship with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Russian captain of cargo ship Solong jailed over fatal North Sea collision
item.description: A judge describes Vladimir Motin as "an accident waiting to happen" as he hands the Russian national a six-year jail term.

item.title: New study reveals how stressful footy fandom can be
item.description: A new study reveals how much high-stakes sporting events can get the heart pumping by strapping trackers to over 200 German football fans.

item.title: Russia and Ukraine conduct POW swap after latest US-led peace talks
item.description: The Kremlin says it sees progress and positive movement in the talks, brokered by the United States, as Donald Trump urges both sides to reach a peace deal.

item.title: Valentino Guseli gets snowboard big air wildcard, leaps into final at Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics
item.description: Valentino Guseli only found out he had been added to the big air field a couple of hours before the competition start after a rival's injury, but still found a way to make it to the final.

item.title: Epstein files reveal the men who looked away after women had spoken up
item.description: The millions of pages of documents related to the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein have shone a light on how many influential men were ready to disregard the experiences of countless women.

item.title: Country Fire Authority volunteers speak out about aging firefighting fleets, volunteer shortages
item.description: Volunteer firefighters battling blazes that razed homes and destroyed livestock in Victoria last month say they contended with failing radios and broken down trucks, as questions mount over the viability of the Country Fire Authority.

item.title: Positive spin from Liberal leader as retiring MP Sam Groth forces Nepean by-election
item.description: When retiring first-term Liberal Sam Groth told his leader he was quitting politics, forcing a by-election, Jess Wilson didn't try to talk him out of it.

item.title: Today in history, February 6: The Manchester United team that perished in the Munich air disaster of 1958
item.description: On a snowy February afternoon in 1958, the football team that many were calling the greatest that Britain had ever produced stopped to refuel at Munich Airport. The plane would never take off, and the Flowers of Manchester would take years to bloom again.

item.title: Weekly news quiz: The government's fire sale, a box office bomb and a new religion
item.description: Test yourself with this week's news quiz.

item.title: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese to sign security treaty with Indonesia
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is in Jakarta to sign the treaty, which the Australian government calls the "biggest step" the countries have taken together in 30 years.

item.title: Former attorney-general Mark Dreyfus warned anti-corruption chief to 'manage' or 'avoid' conflicts
item.description: A letter from Mark Dreyfus to Paul Brereton provides new insight into the expectations set for the inaugural chief of the anti-corruption watchdog.

item.title: Effect of capital gains tax changes on housing affordability likely depends on design
item.description: Labor has not ruled out changes to the capital gains tax discount but wants any tax changes to improve housing affordability.

item.title: Jim Chalmers's appetite for economic reform is about to be tested
item.description: Jim Chalmers could face his biggest test yet as treasurer over the next few months.

item.title: Zombie movie We Bury The Dead set in Tasmania, but filmed in WA due to cost
item.description: Despite being set in Tasmania and featuring Hobart being blown to pieces in an explosion, a new zombie horror movie starring Star Wars heroine Daisy Ridley had to be filmed in WA because of "logistical" challenges.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: When does it start, what sports are there and who is competing
item.description: Australia is tipped for enormous success over the next couple of weeks so now might be a good time to clue yourself up. Here's everything you need to know about the 2026 Winter Games.

item.title: The questions dogging the search for Gus Lamont after latest police update
item.description: Police declared the disappearance of Gus Lamont a major crime due to "a number of inconsistencies and discrepancies" emerging during the four-month investigation.

item.title: An ex-jihadi and terror experts agree on one thing about extremism
item.description: As police probe what led to the deadliest terror attack on Australian soil last month, radicalisation researchers and a former Islamic State group supporter have shed light on how people are recruited.

item.title: Satellite images reveal build-up of US fighter jets and missile defences ahead of US-Iran nuclear talks
item.description: Ahead of planned nuclear talks between the United States and Iran, satellite imagery reveals how the US is positioning itself for potential military escalation.

item.title: World Anti-Doping Agency bosses 'will look at' claims of penis enlargement in ski jumping
item.description: The World Anti-Doping Agency will investigate bizarre claims in German newspaper Bild that ski jumpers are injecting substances into their penises to aid aerodynamics — and other stories from the Winter Olympics a day out from the opening ceremony.

item.title: Racehorse owner charged after gelding found dead on Maryborough property
item.description: A six-year-old gelding had career winnings of $90,000 before it was found dead on a central Victorian property.

item.title: US hopes to challenge China's critical minerals dominance with new trading bloc
item.description: The US is urging dozens of countries to follow Australia's lead and sign onto a plan to stop relying on China for the critical minerals used in modern technology.

item.title: Alice Springs powerlifter Jessica Coombe encourages more women to take up the sport
item.description: What started as a weight loss journey has turned into competitive powerlifting for this Alice Springs mum.

item.title: After the ICE shooting of Renee Nicole Good in Minneapolis, a week of chaos unfolds
item.description: Renee Good and her wife moved to Minneapolis "to make a better life" with their six-year-old son. But just over two minutes into an encounter with ICE agents she was fatally shot.

item.title: State coroner recommends NSW government adopt Escape. Hide. Tell awareness campaign
item.description: The recommendation was one of 23 handed down on Thursday as part of the Bondi Junction stabbing inquest findings.

item.title: What Israel's President Isaac Herzog has said about Gaza, and why he won't be arrested in Australia
item.description: When Israel's president lands in Australia this weekend, he can expect an official red carpet treatment. But he will be all too aware of the controversy his visit is generating.

item.title: ATO debt continues to drive record level of calls to small business financial helpline
item.description: Financial counsellors say small businesses struggling to pay debts owed to the tax office are driving calls to Australia's Small Business Debt Helpline higher.

item.title: Mark Parton admits negotiations for a Greens and Liberals coalition were 'very serious'
item.description: The leader of the Canberra Liberals has confirmed for the first time that talks with the ACT Greens about forming a coalition to unseat the ACT Labor government were "very serious".

item.title: Karnivool's new album In Verses was worth the 13-year wait, bagpipes and all
item.description: They're one of Australia's most revered heavy acts. And arguably the most patient. Karnivool unpack the 13-year journey to their new album, In Verses.

item.title: Two young sisters die in hospital days after fire ripped through their Townsville home
item.description: Two children die in hospital after a fire ripped through a Queensland home earlier this week.

item.title: Savannah Guthrie's missing mother is 'still out there,' police say, but no suspects
item.description: US investigators believe the missing mother of Today show host Savannah Guthrie is "still out there" despite having no proof she is still alive.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Late NSW tradie Brett Mckay connected with thousands by sharing cancer battle online
item.description: When NSW tradie Brett Mckay started sharing videos of his cancer journey with his mates on social media, he did not expect thousands of strangers to come along for the ride.

item.title: NFL confirms Los Angeles Rams vs San Francisco 49ers in Australia at the MCG
item.description: The first regular-season NFL match played on Australian shores has been confirmed as a clash between division rivals.

item.title: Voters in David Littleproud's seat of Maranoa weigh in amid Coalition split, One Nation surge
item.description: As One Nation announces its plan to open an office in Longreach, the ABC speaks to voters in David Littleproud's electorate to get their thoughts on the Nationals leader.

item.title: Live: ASX to open in the red as Bitcoin crashes
item.description: The ASX is set to open down, as the cryptocurrency Bitcoin plunges in value. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Live: Jane Hume says Liberals can go it alone without Nationals, One Nation
item.description: Liberal senator Jane Hume says her party can go at it alone without joining forces with the Nationals or One Nation. Follow live.

item.title: Georgia Voll helps Royal Challengers Bengaluru win Indian Women's Premier League
item.description: Royal Challengers Bengaluru pulled off the biggest successful chase in the Women's Premier League to win their second title in the Indian franchise-based T20 league.

item.title: Man flown to hospital with burns after assault at Bacchus Marsh property
item.description: Detectives from the Arson and Explosives Squad are investigating an assault that left a man critically injured with burns at Bacchus Marsh.

item.title: Outback mayor says Queensland government is building homes on flood-prone land
item.description: Locals, the council and a Queensland MP are questioning the wisdom of a Queensland government plan to build dwellings in an area of Burketown known to flood.

item.description: The NT Treasurer Bill Yan outlines his plans for the NT's financial future, saying private investment will be key to turning the debt around.

item.title: Fisheries Minister Jackie Jarvis defends controversial Perth and WA demersal fishing ban
item.description: A "judgement call" about a permanent commercial fishing ban for demersal species went further than the advice handed to her, WA's Fisheries Minister Jackie Jarvis says.

item.title: WA Premier Roger Cook writes letter to 13yo hero swimmer Austin Appelbee
item.description: Premier Roger Cook writes to the 13-year-old, who made international headlines after swimming 4 kilometres in rough seas to raise the alarm and save his family.

item.description: Here's everything you need to know about the Super Bowl, including when it will start, how to watch, and who you'll see on the stage at half-time.

item.title: Pharmacy apologises after customers given wrong medicines, scripts in Broome
item.description: More than a dozen customers have come forward over concerns two Broome chemists have handed out the wrong medications.

item.title: ABC reporter and newsreader Nick McLaren looks back on three decades of reporting in Wollongong
item.description: ABC journalist Nick McLaren reflects on three decades of change and rebirth in the steel city of Wollongong.

item.title: NSW chief justice criticises Tony Abbott's comments on Sydney Harbour Bridge protest
item.description: The former prime minister said it should not be for judges to decide when a political protest was justified, which are remarks NSW's top judge called "regrettable".

item.title: Queensland man to face court after allegedly threatening federal politicians on social media
item.description: Police allege the 39-year-old posted threatening messages to parliamentarians on X in December.

item.title: Magnetic fields, psychedelics and ketamine helping to treat the brain
item.description: A Queensland not-for-profit mental health clinic that delivers novel therapies such as ketamine and psilocybin is expanding its services.

item.title: Prosecutors abandon drug trafficking case against Tony Mokbel
item.description: Prosecutors have abandoned a drug trafficking case against underworld figure Tony Mokbel following his release from prison last year.

item.title: Nearly 70 people rescued from New York ski mountain
item.description: Rescuers have saved nearly 70 skiers who were stranded for hours, with some trapped up to 21 metres in the air, after a gondola malfunction in New York.

item.title: Oscar Piastri defends McLaren and says he expects 'fair shot' at F1 title in 2026
item.description: Oscar Piastri insists the painful ending to his F1 title bid last season has only strengthened his resolve to be the "nice person" who brings the Formula 1 world drivers' crown back to Australia.

item.title: US-Russia nuclear weapons treaty expires as Trump rejects Moscow's one-year extension
item.description: The last remaining nuclear arms pact between Russia and the United States has expired after Donald Trump rejected an offer from his Russian counterpart.

item.title: Man and woman charged over alleged domestic violence murder in Goulburn
item.description: Two people in their 40s have been charged over the alleged domestic violence murder of a 48-year-old woman in Goulburn earlier this year.
